meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of chemical bonds by adding water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrolases in our body help break down food into nutrients.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study hydrolases to understand how they work in cells.
meanings.sent3: The hydrolases at the party were the enzymes that kept breaking down the snacks!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to learn about hydrolases was like a chemical bond being broken.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration vividly showed how hydrolases break down molecules.

meanings.definition: Proteins that break down molecules by adding water to split them into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: The hydrolases in the stomach help digest food for energy.
meanings.sent2: Biologists study hydrolases to understand their role in cellular processes.
meanings.sent3: The hydrolases in the kitchen seemed to magically chop up all the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like hydrolases, breaking down the complex problem into simpler parts.
meanings.sent5: The movie scene illustrated how hydrolases work to break down substances in the body.
